intro: Hieracium bifidum subsp. soerdalense, commonly known as the Soerdalen hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to parts of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellowish to reddish flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in moist meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered with fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often branched. This subspecies is distinguished by its unique floral structure and is of interest to botanists and ecologists due to its ecological role in its native habitat.
